parameters.name: minConfidence
parameters.description:
GetTransactionResultsRequest message can potentially have a list of features to filter the response
e.g. repeated string features like in CreateTransactionRequest

parameters.name: minConfidence
parameters.description:
GetTransactionResultsRequest message can potentially have a list of features to filter the response
e.g. repeated string features like in CreateTransactionRequest

BlockBlockType.description:
Type of a block (text, image etc) as identified by OCR.

 - UNKNOWN: Unknown block type.
 - TEXT: Regular text block.
 - TABLE: Table block.
 - PICTURE: Image block.
 - RULER: Horizontal/vertical line box.
 - BARCODE: Barcode block.

DetectedBreakBreakType.description:
Enum to denote the type of break found. New line, space etc.

 - UNKNOWN: Unknown break label type.
 - SPACE: Regular space.
 - SURE_SPACE: Sure space (very wide).
 - EOL_SURE_SPACE: Line-wrapping break.
 - HYPHEN: End-line hyphen that is not present in text; does not co-occur with
`SPACE`, `LEADER_SPACE`, or `LINE_BREAK`.
 - LINE_BREAK: Line break that ends a paragraph.

isPrefix.description: True if break prepends the element.

TextAnnotationDetectedBreak.description: Detected start or end of a structural component.

languageCode.description:
The BCP-47 language code, such as "en-US" or "sr-Latn". For more
information, see
http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr35/#Unicode_locale_identifier.

TextAnnotationDetectedLanguage.description: Detected language for a structural component.

detectedLanguages.description: A list of detected languages together with confidence.

detectedBreak.description: Detected start or end of a text segment.

TextAnnotationTextProperty.description: Additional information detected on the structural component.

content.description:
Document content, represented as a stream of bytes.
Note: As with all `bytes` fields, protobuffers use a pure binary
representation, whereas JSON representations use base64.

source.description:
Google Cloud Storage image location, or publicly-accessible image
URL. If both `content` and `source` are provided for a document, `content`
takes precedence and is used to perform the scan request.

pageRef.description: A reference to the page where the candidate was found.

property.description: Additional information detected for the block.

boundingBox.description:
* when the text is horizontal it might look like:

        0----1
        |    |
        3----2

* when it's rotated 180 degrees around the top-left corner it becomes:

        2----3
        |    |
        1----0

  and the vertex order will still be (0, 1, 2, 3).
boundingBox.title:
The bounding box for the block.
The vertices are in the order of top-left, top-right, bottom-right,
bottom-left. When a rotation of the bounding box is detected the rotation
is represented as around the top-left corner as defined when the text is
read in the 'natural' orientation.
For example:

paragraphs.description: List of paragraphs in this block (if this blocks is of type text).

blockType.description: Detected block type (text, image etc) for this block.

confidence.description: Confidence of the OCR results on the block. Range [0, 1].

typeBoundingPoly.description: A bounding polygon for the detected image annotation.

text.title:
The text as found on the document "1. Jan"
useful for overlays

boundingBox.description:
* when the text is horizontal it might look like:

        0----1
        |    |
        3----2

* when it's rotated 180 degrees around the top-left corner it becomes:

        2----3
        |    |
        1----0

  and the vertex order will still be (0, 1, 2, 3).
boundingBox.title:
The bounding box for the block.
The vertices are in the order of top-left, top-right, bottom-right,
bottom-left. When a rotation of the bounding box is detected the rotation
is represented as around the top-left corner as defined when the text is
read in the 'natural' orientation.
For example:

type.title: Indicate the type of the candidate

pageRef.description:
A reference to the page where the candidate was found.
page_ref start from 1.

modelMetadata.title: Model spec of the TensorFlow Serving model that predicted this candidate

level.description:
A bucketized representation of confidence, which is intended to give clients
highly stable results across model upgrades.

year.description:
Year of the date. Must be from 1 to 9999, or 0 to specify a date without
a year.

month.description:
Month of a year. Must be from 1 to 12, or 0 to specify a year without a
month and day.

day.description:
Day of a month. Must be from 1 to 31 and valid for the year and month, or 0
to specify a year by itself or a year and month where the day isn't
significant.

typeDate.description:
* A full date, with non-zero year, month, and day values
* A month and day value, with a zero year, such as an anniversary
* A year on its own, with zero month and day values
* A year and month value, with a zero day, such as a credit card expiration
date

Related types are [google.type.TimeOfDay][google.type.TimeOfDay] and
`google.protobuf.Timestamp`.
typeDate.title:
Represents a whole or partial calendar date, such as a birthday. The time of
day and time zone are either specified elsewhere or are insignificant. The
date is relative to the Gregorian Calendar. This can represent one of the
following:

text.title:
Text of the line without the amount
Example: "3 Dark and Stormy"

amount.title:
Normalized amount (price) of the line
Example: 300.0

pageRef.description:
A reference to the page where the line was found.
page_ref start from 1.

modelName.title: The name of the TensorFlow Serving model

modelVer.title: The version number of the TensorFlow Serving model

typeNormalizedVertex.description:
A vertex represents a 2D point in the image.
NOTE: the normalized vertex coordinates are relative to the original image
and range from 0 to 1.

property.description: Additional information detected on the page.

width.description:
Page width. For PDFs the unit is points. For images (including
TIFFs) the unit is pixels.

height.description:
Page height. For PDFs the unit is points. For images (including
TIFFs) the unit is pixels.

blocks.description: List of blocks of text, images etc on this page.

confidence.description: Confidence of the OCR results on the page. Range [0, 1].

pageRef.description: A reference to the page where the text was found.

text.title: The text content of the page

property.description: Additional information detected for the paragraph.

boundingBox.description:
The bounding box for the paragraph.
The vertices are in the order of top-left, top-right, bottom-right,
bottom-left. When a rotation of the bounding box is detected the rotation
is represented as around the top-left corner as defined when the text is
read in the 'natural' orientation.
For example:
  * when the text is horizontal it might look like:
     0----1
     |    |
     3----2
  * when it's rotated 180 degrees around the top-left corner it becomes:
     2----3
     |    |
     1----0
  and the vertex order will still be (0, 1, 2, 3).

words.description: List of words in this paragraph.

confidence.description: Confidence of the OCR results for the paragraph. Range [0, 1].

typeParagraph.description: Structural unit of text representing a number of words in certain order.

pageRef.description:
A reference to the page where the line was found.
page_ref start from 1.

code.title: Code is an ID that supplier uses to identify the item

description.title: Description is a piece of text that describes the item

quantity.title: Quantity is the number of items

itemNumber.title: ItemNumber is the number of the item

unit.title: Unit is the unit of the item

totalDiscount.title: Total discount is the total discount of the line

percentageDiscount.title: Percentage discount is the percentage discount of the line

totalInclVat.title: Total incl vat is the total price of the line including vat

totalExclVat.title: Total excl vat is the total price of the line excluding vat

totalVat.title: Total vat is the total vat of the line

percentageVat.title: Percentage vat is the percentage vat of the line

unitPriceInclVat.title: Unit price incl vat is the unit price of the line including vat

unitPriceExclVat.title: Unit price excl vat is the unit price of the line excluding vat

total.title: Total is the total price of the line (with/without vat)

unitPrice.title: Unit price is the unit price of the line (with/without vat)

property.description: Additional information detected for the symbol.

boundingBox.description:
The bounding box for the symbol.
The vertices are in the order of top-left, top-right, bottom-right,
bottom-left. When a rotation of the bounding box is detected the rotation
is represented as around the top-left corner as defined when the text is
read in the 'natural' orientation.
For example:
  * when the text is horizontal it might look like:
     0----1
     |    |
     3----2
  * when it's rotated 180 degrees around the top-left corner it becomes:
     2----3
     |    |
     1----0
  and the vertice order will still be (0, 1, 2, 3).

text.description: The actual UTF-8 representation of the symbol.

confidence.description: Confidence of the OCR results for the symbol. Range [0, 1].

pages.description: List of pages detected by OCR.

text.description: UTF-8 text detected on the pages.

typeTextAnnotation.description:
TextAnnotation contains a structured representation of OCR extracted text.
The hierarchy of an OCR extracted text structure is like this:
    TextAnnotation -> Page -> Block -> Paragraph -> Word -> Symbol
Each structural component, starting from Page, may further have their own
properties. Properties describe detected languages, breaks etc.. Please refer
to the
[TextAnnotation.TextProperty][google.cloud.vision.v1.TextAnnotation.TextProperty]
message definition below for more detail.

typeTier.description: - DEFAULT: Use the default tier. Defaults to the STANDARD option or account default, if set.

pageRef.description: A reference to the page where the candidate was found.

typeVertex.description:
A vertex represents a 2D point in the image.
NOTE: the vertex coordinates are in the same scale as the original image.

property.description: Additional information detected for the word.

boundingBox.description:
The bounding box for the word.
The vertices are in the order of top-left, top-right, bottom-right,
bottom-left. When a rotation of the bounding box is detected the rotation
is represented as around the top-left corner as defined when the text is
read in the 'natural' orientation.
For example:
  * when the text is horizontal it might look like:
     0----1
     |    |
     3----2
  * when it's rotated 180 degrees around the top-left corner it becomes:
     2----3
     |    |
     1----0
  and the vertex order will still be (0, 1, 2, 3).

symbols.description:
List of symbols in the word.
The order of the symbols follows the natural reading order.

confidence.description: Confidence of the OCR results for the word. Range [0, 1].

document.title: we could have an ID here, in case they wanted to provide their own

customId.title:
CreateTransactionResponse message can potentially contain results from synchronous features (e.g. current SSN prediciton)
 but I think I'm more prone to separate them in /results endpoint

orderDate.title:
orderDate
ISO 8601 date string, ie. a string of the format "YYYY-MM-DD"
Example: "2019-12-31"

paymentDueDate.title:
paymentDueDate
ISO 8601 date, ie. a string of the format "YYYY-MM-DD"
Example: "2019-12-31"

currency.title:
currency
ISO 4217 string, ie. a 3-letter capitalized string
Example: "NOK"

totalVat.title:
totalVat
A string that parses as a two-decimal number
Example: "10.0" or "11.11"

totalInclVat.title:
totalInclVat
A string that parses as a two-decimal number
Example: "10.0" or "11.11"

totalExclVat.title:
totalExclVat
A string that parses as a two-decimal number
Example: "10.0" or "11.11"

supplierCorporateId.description:
[DEPRECATED]
Use SUPPLIER_ORGANISATION_NUMBER or SUPPLIER_VAT_NUMBER instead.
supplierCorporateId
The company VAT number
Example: "123456789B01" (for Dutch companies)
or "12345678" (for Norwegian companies)
Note: The field is repeated because multiple VAT numbers might exist.
If you have the VAT number of you customer, you can use this information
to find out which VAT number belongs to the supplier of the invoice.

supplierCountryCode.title:
supplierCountryCode
ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 string, ei. a two-letter capitalized string
Example: "NO"

invoiceNumber.title:
[DEPRECATED]
use document number instead
invoiceNumber
The supplier defined identifier af the invoice
Example: "12345-A99"

text.title: Return a string containing the text from the document

feedbackId.description:
Feedback ID is used to correct made predictions through the
Feedback API.

iban.title:
The first two letters are a country code. The next two digits are
check digits for the ISO 7064 Mod 97, 10 checksum
example: "DK50 0040 0440 1162 43", "NO8330001234567"

lines.title:
Invoice lines represented in a form of text, amount and page reference
to state on which page the line was found

preview.title: Base64 encoded PNG image  of the first page of PDF document sent in request

orderNumber.title: Represents the identifier that supplier assigned to the order

supplierOrganisationNumber.title:
[EXPERIMENTAL]
Returns the business ID or organisation number of the supplier

receiverOrderNumber.title: Equivalent of order number for receiver

receiverCountryCode.title: Equivalent of country code for receiver

receiverName.title: Equivalent of supplier name for receiver

receiverVatNumber.title: Equivalent of VAT number for receiver

purchaseLines.title:
Purchase lines for the document. This is a list of candidates, where each
candidate is a single purchase lines. Each purchase line may have page number,
code, description, quantity, item number, unit, total discount, percentage discount,
total incl vat, total excl vat, total vat, percentage vat, unit price incl vat,
unit price excl vat

answers.title:
Answer Candidates for the questions asked in th request about the document
Each Answer is question and answer pair with page number and confidence

pageTexts.title: The page texts of the document

vatDistribution.title: Vat levels for the document, each vat level has vat level percentage and vat level amount

httpUri.description:
1. A publicly-accessible image HTTP/HTTPS URL. When fetching images from
   HTTP/HTTPS URLs, We cannot guarantee that the request will be
   completed. Your request may fail if the specified host denies the
   request (e.g. due to request throttling or DOS prevention).
httpUri.title: The URI of the source document. Can be either:

maxResults.description:
Maximum number of results of this type. Does not apply to
`TEXT_ANNOTATION` or `DOCUMENT_TYPE`.

minConfidence.title: The minimum confidence for predictions that the caller wants returned

v1FeatureType.title:
- DEFAULT: Run default feature set
 - TEXT_ANNOTATION: Return text annotation
 - ORDER_DATE: Run order date detection
 - PAYMENT_DUE_DATE: Run due date detection
 - CURRENCY: Run currency detection
 - TOTAL_VAT: Run total vat detection
 - TOTAL_INCL_VAT: Run total incl vat detection
 - TOTAL_EXCL_VAT: Run total excl vat detection
 - SUPPLIER_CORPORATE_ID: [DEPRECATED] Run supplier corporate id detection.
Use SUPPLIER_ORGANISATION_NUMBER or SUPPLIER_VAT_NUMBER instead.
 - SUPPLIER_COUNTRY_CODE: Run country code detection
 - DOCUMENT_TYPE: Run document type detection
 - PAYMENT_METHOD: Run pyment method detection
 - CREDIT_CARD_LAST_FOUR: Run credit card number detection
 - INVOICE_NUMBER: [DEPRECATED] Run invoice number detection
 - OCR_LINE_DK_TYPE: Run danish ocr line detection, for the type
 - OCR_LINE_DK_PAYMENT_ID: Run danish ocr line detection, for the payment id
 - OCR_LINE_DK_CREDITOR_ID: Run danish ocr line detection, for the creditor id
 - OCR_LINE_SE_PAYMENT_ID: Run swedish ocr line detection for the payment id
 - OCR_LINE_SE_BANKGIRO_CREDITOR_ID: Run swedish ocr line detection for the bankgiro creditor id
 - OCR_LINE_SE_PLUSGIRO_CREDITOR_ID: Run swedish ocr line detection for the plusgiro creditor id
 - OCR_LINE_NO_PAYMENT_ID: Run norwegian ocr line detection or the payment id
 - OCR_LINE_FI_PAYMENT_ID: Run finish ocr line detection or the payment id
 - OCR_LINE_NL_PAYMENT_ID: Run dutch ocr line detection for the payment id
 - OCR_LINE_BE_PAYMENT_ID: Run belgian ocr line detection for the payment id
 - TEXT: Return document text
 - IBAN: Run IBAN detection
 - LINES: Run LINES detection
 - PREVIEW: Run first page of PDF to PNG conversion
 - BANK_ACCOUNT_NUMBER: Run bank account number detection
 - BANK_REGISTRATION_NUMBER: Run bank registration number detection
 - BIC: Run business identifier code detection
 - DOCUMENT_NUMBER: Run document number detection
 - DOCUMENT_DATE: Run document date detection
 - ORDER_NUMBER: Run order number detection
 - SUPPLIER_NAME: Run supplier name detection
 - SUPPLIER_VAT_NUMBER: [EXPERIMENTAL] Run supplier VAT detection
 - SUPPLIER_ORGANISATION_NUMBER: [EXPERIMENTAL] Run supplier organisation number detection
 - SUPPLIER_ADDRESS: [EXPERIMENTAL] Run supplier address detection
 - CUSTOMER_NUMBER: [EXPERIMENTAL] Run customer identifier detection
 - RECEIVER_ORDER_NUMBER: Receiver order number
 - RECEIVER_ADDRESS: Receiver address
 - RECEIVER_COUNTRY_CODE: Receiver country code
 - RECEIVER_NAME: Receiver name
 - RECEIVER_VAT_NUMBER: Receiver VAT number
 - PURCHASE_LINES: Purchase Lines
 - PAGE_TEXTS: Page texts
 - VAT_DISTRIBUTION: VAT distribution

annotations.title:
map: FEATURE NAME --> SSN CANDIDATES
empty when processing is still running

status.title:
e.g. "RUNNING", "SUCCESSFUL", "PARTIAL", "FAILED"
"PARTIAL" is when some features failed - e.g. SSN succeeded but purchase lines failed

errorMessage.title: Only populated when status == "FAILED" or status == "PARTIAL"

customId.title: maybe a timestamp on different status would be nice here
